headers.subject: [tosdr:2030] Bing.com completely anonymizes logs after 18 months.

html:
Bing.com has its own Privacy Policy, even though it uses the Microsoft Services Agreement for its ToS. These privacy points apply only to Bing.com.


Storage and Retention:

We store search terms (and the cookie IDs associated with search terms) separately from any account information that directly identifies the user, such as name, e-mail address, or phone numbers. Further, we have built-in technological and procedural safeguards designed to prevent the unauthorized correlation of this data. We take additional steps to protect the privacy of stored search information by removing the entirety of the IP address after 6 months, cookies and other cross session identifiers, after 18 months.

 

From <http://www.microsoft.com/privacystatement/en-us/bing/default.aspx#> 

--
tosdr.org | twitter.com/tosdr | github.com/tosdr

subject: Bing.com completely anonymizes logs after 18 months.
text:
Bing.com has its own Privacy Policy, even though it uses the Microsoft 
Services Agreement for its ToS. These privacy points apply only to Bing.com.


Storage and Retention:
>
> We store search terms (and the cookie IDs associated with search terms) 
> separately from any account information that directly identifies the user, 
> such as name, e-mail address, or phone numbers. Further, we have built-in 
> technological and procedural safeguards designed to prevent the 
> unauthorized correlation of this data. We take additional steps to protect 
> the privacy of stored search information by removing the entirety of the IP 
> address after 6 months, cookies and other cross session identifiers, after 
> 18 months.
>
>  
>
> From <http://www.microsoft.com/privacystatement/en-us/bing/default.aspx#>
